thread.title: RSPCA - terms and conditions

author: The Telegraph
title: RSPCA - terms and conditions
text: 1. This prize draw is open to residents of the UK, Channel Islands, Isle of Man and Republic of Ireland aged 18 years or over, except employees of Telegraph Media Group Limited and its group companies (“Promoter”) and the RSPCA, their families, agents or anyone else professionally associated with the draw. 2. Details of how to enter form part of the terms and conditions. It is a condition of entry that all rules are accepted as final and that the competitor agrees to abide by these rules. The decision of the judges is final and no correspondence will be entered into. 3. Entries must be submitted via www.telegraph.co.uk/rspca and entry is restricted to one per person. Once submitted, entries cannot be amended in any way. 4. Late, illegible, incomplete, defaced or corrupt entries or entries sent through agencies and third parties will not be accepted. No responsibility can be accepted for lost entries and proof of despatch will not be accepted as proof of receipt. One 1st Prize winner and 10 runners-up will be drawn at random from all entries received by the closing date. The winners’ names and counties can be obtained by sending a sae to RSPCA Legacy Prize Draw Winners, SPARK, Telegraph Media Group, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT within one month after the closing date of the prize draw. 5. All entries must be received by midnight on Sunday, December 27, 2015. 6. The winners will be contacted within 14 days of the closing date of the prize draw. Should the Promoter be unable to contact the winner or should the winner be unable to accept the prize, the Promoter reserves the right to award the prize to an alternative winner, drawn in accordance with these terms and conditions. 7. The prizes as described are available on the date of publication. Should a prize become unavailable, a substitute of equal value shall be provided. 8. One winning entrant will win the 1st Prize of an accompanied tour of an RSPCA Animal Centre, RSPCA Animal Hospital or RSPCA Wildlife Centre for two people. The winner can choose from the nearest available centre to visit at a mutually agreed date and time. The tour will include meeting RSPCA staff including an RSPCA Inspector. Light refreshments will be provided appropriate to the time of visit i.e. morning or afternoon. The winner will also receive a £100 RSPCA voucher, redeemable online only at shop.rspca.org.uk and valid for 24 months from the date of issue. 9. 10 runners-up will each win a £25 RSPCA voucher, redeemable online only at shop.rspca.org.uk and valid for 24 months from the date of issue. 10. The 1st Prize must be taken as one package. 11. The 1st Prize does not include travel, travel insurance, food and drink, personal expenditure or incidental costs, other than where mentioned. 12. The 1st Prize is valid for 12 months from the date of the winner being notified and must be agreed with the winner’s choice of RSPCA centre three weeks in advance. The visit is subject to the availability of RSPCA staff. 13. The prizes are subject to availability, non transferable and there are no cash alternatives. 14. The winners may be required to participate in reasonable publicity on behalf of the Promoter and the RSPCA. 15. Entrants’ data will be used for the purpose of administration of this prize draw and in accordance with the permissions granted or withheld at the point of entry. The Promoter is the data controller of entrants’ personal data under its privacy policy, which can be found here If you have agreed to be contacted by the RSPCA for future campaigns and activities, the RSPCA will become the data controller for the maintenance and management of your data once your details are received from the Promoter. Full details can be found here . 16. Events may occur that render the prize draw itself or the awarding of the prize impossible due to reasons beyond the control of the Promoter and accordingly the Promoter may at its absolute discretion vary or amend the promotion and the entrant agrees that no liability shall attach to the Promoter as a result thereof. 17. The Telegraph is responsible for the first part of the promotion, which is the publication and adjudication of the prize draw. Provision of the prize is the responsibility the RSPCA. 18. These Terms and Conditions are to be interpreted in accordance with English law and any dispute arising out of these Terms or their subject matter is subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the English Courts. Promoter: Telegraph Media Group Limited, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT.
